Text: Ttile: Serendipity at the Bus Sotp

INT. BUS STOP - DAY

The bus stop is a simple shelter with a bench, located on a busy street in a small town. The sun is shining and there's a light breeze.

Two strangers, JAMES (mid-30s, wearing business attire) and LUCY (late 20s, dressed casually), sit on opposite ends of the bench waiting for their respective buses. They both seem lost in thought, occasionally glancing at each other but not making conversation.

JAMES
(looking at his watch)
This bus is always late...

LUCY
(smiling)
Tell me about it. I've been waiting here for twenty minutes already.

They share a brief laugh, breaking the ice between them.

JAMES
I'm James, by the way.

LUCY
Nice to meet you, James. I'm Lucy.

James notices a book sticking out of Lucy's bag - "To Kill A Mockingbird" by Harper Lee.

JAMES
(pointing at the book)
Great book! It's one of my favorites.

LUCY
(surprised)
Really? Mine too! I must have read it at least five times.

JAMES
Same here. There's just something about Scout's innocence that gets me every time.

As they continue talking, they discover more shared interests - their love for old movies, Italian food, and hiking.

LUCY
(excited)
Have you ever hiked up Mount Bradley? The view from the top is amazing!

JAMES
(nodding)
Yes! I try to go there at least once a year. Last time, I even camped overnight.

LUCY
(wistful)
That sounds wonderful. I've always wanted to do that.

Just then, two buses arrive simultaneously - one heading left, the other right. Both James and Lucy stand up, realizing they need to board separate buses.

JAMES
(disappointed)
Well, I guess this is where we part ways.

LUCY
(smiling)
It was really nice meeting you, James. Maybe we'll run into each other again sometime.

They exchange a warm smile before boarding their respective buses.

INT. BUS - DAY

As the buses pull away from the stop, both James and Lucy take one last glance at each other through the windows, smiling.

James takes out his phone and starts typing a message:

"Hey, it's James from the bus stop. Would you like to grab coffee sometime?"

He hesitates for a moment before hitting send.

EXT. COFFEE SHOP - DAY (ONE WEEK LATER)

James and Lucy sit outside at a small table, laughing and enjoying their coffee. They've clearly grown closer since their chance encounter at the bus stop.

FADE OUT
